image.altText: A composite of images linked to the Snowtown murders.

props.synopsis: James Vlassakis — the man whose testimony helped to convict serial killers John Bunting and Robert Wagner — has applied for release on parole.

title.children: Youngest Snowtown murderer applies for release on parole

image.altText: A woman with dyed hair and a man with a neck tattoo huddle together for a selfie.

props.synopsis: A man and a woman will spend five months in jail for making fake $50 and $100 notes after deciding that it was an "easy" way to make money.

title.children: Jail for couple inspired to counterfeit cash after watching TikTok video

image.altText: Adrian Portelli holds several 100 dollar bills in his hand

props.synopsis: The property investor and social media influencer will stand trial in an Adelaide court later this year after pleading not guilty to several charges of conducting an unlawful lottery.

title.children: Adrian Portelli ordered to stand trial over unlawful lottery allegations

image.altText: Anthony Albanese takes a selfie with members of the Labor faithful.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Opposition Leader Peter Dutton make eleventh hour trips to South Australia, where both have targeted the most marginal seat in the state.

title.children: Leaders target key SA seats in final days of election campaign

image.altText: A small aeroplane at rest in a dusty paddock.

props.synopsis: The ATSB has found that the 22-year-old man's Cessna aerodynamically stalled while he was carrying out mustering work.

title.children: Young pilot's aircraft stalled before deadly crash, report finds

image.altText: A green sign for Hydrogen Power SA erected on a vacant arid site in Whyalla

props.synopsis: The SA government insists it remains committed to hydrogen as a source of fuel over the long term, but the opposition says a proposed project near Whyalla is now "in tatters".

title.children: Hydrogen and water projects 'in tatters', SA opposition says

image.altText: A woman at SA parliament staring at the camera.

props.synopsis: The SA government's apology in parliament to people affected by the use of pelvic mesh — including "for the pain, embarrassment and gaslighting they've endured" — needs to be followed by practical steps, an advocate says.

title.children: Pelvic mesh apology a 'first step', but advocate calls for lifelong care

image.altText: Parts of a regional highway that shows both sealed roads and washed away portions

props.synopsis: The real challenge for the outback community is beginning as floodwaters start to clear, with critical infrastructure showing signs of serious damage.

title.children: Long road to recovery for Innamincka as receding floodwaters expose damage

image.altText: Six glasses of red wine being held up for a toast, the drinkers' hands are visible

props.synopsis: Australian wine began flowing back into China last year when tariffs were removed, but overall exports are declining significantly.

title.children: Australian wine exports on the slide as world drinks less

image.altText: An Adelaide Lightning player lays the ball up.

props.synopsis: The future of South Australia's women's basketball team is in limbo, with the Adelaide Lightning at loggerheads with the WNBL about the club's future in the national competition.

title.children: Adelaide Lightning in limbo amid stand-off with WNBL

image.altText: A man in a khaki shirt and hat kneels and holds a bag open for a woman to place a golden bandicoot inside at Wild Deserts

props.synopsis: Prior to the project, the native species had been locally extinct in outback NSW for decades after they were wiped out by pests.

title.children: 'Genuine excitement' as scientists release bilbies, bandicoots into wild

image.altText: Man in light blue suit stands against book shelf

props.synopsis: With a hub based at heritage-listed Ayers House, South Australia's History Festival begins today and runs for the month of May.

title.children: South Australia's History Festival launches with nearly 600 events

image.altText: A girl smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Behind a schoolgirl's love for her idyllic seaside lifestyle is a fear that if change doesn't come soon, she may be among the last to enjoy her town's true beauty.

title.children: They can't vote yet but these kids want Canberra to know what counts

image.altText: a brick building with a Lochert Bros sign and a car parked out the front

props.synopsis: A Riverland West company has been fined $129,000 and convicted on two Work Health and Safety Act counts following a serious degloving incident of a 22-year-old worker.

title.children: Citrus packer fined $129k after 22yo worker degloved by machine

image.altText: A woman stands outside coroners court with a photo of her daughter

props.synopsis: The mother of a woman killed randomly by a man who previously experienced "homicidal ideation" has said the "incompetence" of the mental health system contributed to her death.

title.children: Victim's mum says killer 'slipped through the cracks' of system

image.altText: A man near a shark in shallow water.

props.synopsis: A shark has been returned to the ocean after it became stuck in shallow waters off a South Australian beach.

title.children: Trio free shark stuck in shallow waters

image.altText: a speed sign and a turnoff on a road with a car approaching in the distance

props.synopsis: Residents near major South Australian highways say roads are "not up to scratch" with "bandaid" repair jobs amid proposed changes to federal infrastructure funding that could see the state receive less.

title.children: Anger over highway 'patch jobs' amid less federal cash for SA roads

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair wearing a black dress stands in a hair salon.

props.synopsis: Small businesses in parts of regional South Australia are feeling the pinch as farmers and their families tighten their belts amid record low rainfall.

title.children: Record dry hurting small businesses in country SA

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson's estranged husband tells a court he thought she loved his family in the lead-up to their deaths from eating a poisonous beef Wellington she had cooked.

title.children: Simon Patterson tells court of 'strained' relationship with alleged mushroom killer

image.altText: Kamala Harris delivers a speech standing in front of a white backdrop that says emerge

props.synopsis: Kamala Harris in her first major speech since losing the US election in November said President Donald Trump was "counting on the notion that fear can be contagious."

title.children: Trump has created 'greatest economic crisis' in recent history, says Harris

image.altText: a bald male politician wearing glasses speaks in front of a man standing behind him

props.synopsis: The Coalition has revealed its costings and Labor is feeling optimistic about key seats in Melbourne as election night edges closer.

title.children: Dutton speaks of 'sliding doors moment', Albanese says he's 'nervous'

image.altText: A missile the size of several cars is towed on the back of a truck down a street lined with onlookers

props.synopsis: Experts say a military conflict between the nuclear neighbours is almost guaranteed. When nukes are involved, escalation is a possibility the world takes seriously. What are the odds of it going that far?

title.children: India is on the warpath against Pakistan. What's the risk of nuclear war?

image.altText: South Korea's acting President Han Duck-soo dressed in a suit speaks into two microphones

props.synopsis: Finance Minister Choi Sang-mok is standing in as acting president, as required by law.

title.children: South Korea acting leader Han Duck-soo resigns

image.altText: Colourful painting of man on horse with moutains in background and coloured butterflies overhead.

props.synopsis: Abdul Abdullah has won the $3,000 Packing Room Prize at this year's Archibald Prize for his portrait of Jason Phu.

title.children: Portrait of Jason Phu wins Packing Room Prize in 104th year of the Archibald Prize

image.altText: Two Victoria Police vehicles on the road.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating after antisemitic flyers authorised by neo-Nazis were distributed to Jewish households in Melbourne.

title.children: Neo-Nazi flyers delivered to Jewish households in Melbourne

image.altText: Aerial view of southern right whale cow-calf pairs.

props.synopsis: The southern right whale species had the unfortunate habit of going close to shore, making them easy pickings for whalers. After the practice was banned, their population bounced back — but researchers say something disturbing is happening to their numbers.

title.children: Something is happening with the southern right whale population, scientists say

image.altText: Harry Jones is taken off the ground on a stretcher

props.synopsis: Essendon survives a fierce second-half comeback from North Melbourne to claim a win after losing three players to injury during the match. Follow live.

title.children: Bombers survive frenetic finish to claim thriller after gruesome Jones injury

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Zach Merrett labels thrilling win 'a little bit disappointing'

image.altText: A person holding a violin

props.synopsis: Seeking to learn the origins of a violin built by a mastercraftsman with cheap materials, a repairman opens up the instrument to discover a note left by its creator imprisoned in Dachau concentration camp.

title.children: Note found in violin constructed in Nazi concentration camp

image.altText: Bang amd his mother were sitting in the sofa chair playing with Duo Duo on the coffee table.

props.synopsis: I remember my first vote in China — three candidates, three ballot boxes and voting slips. There was just one thing missing and in Australia, it's everywhere.

title.children: I traded my Chinese passport for the right to cast one free vote

image.altText: A man in religious dress, with his hands pressed together in prayer.

props.synopsis: As dean of the College of Cardinals, this is supposed to be Giovanni Battista Re's moment. There's just one problem: the 91-year-old won't be in the Sistine Chapel when voting for a new pope begins next week.

title.children: This conclave, some of the most influential cardinals won't even be inside

image.altText: Donald Trump's face shown close up while he frowns and looks to his right

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has continued to spruik his government's economic record, hours after a government report showed the US economy had contracted for the first time in three years.

title.children: Trump signals 'tariff wall' for big pharma after US economy shrinks

image.altText: A view of the Jerusalem skyline shrouded in smoke.

props.synopsis: Dry and windy conditions fanned the flames, forcing motorists on the main highway between Jerusalem and Tel Aviv to abandon their cars and run for their lives.

title.children: Israel calls for international help as wildfires erupt near Jerusalem

image.altText: woman holding phone close up

props.synopsis: Rage bait can range from the banal to the extreme, and leave us feeling overwhelmed and isolated. Here's how to spot it, and avoid feeding the beast.

title.children: Social media making you angry? You could be falling for rage bait

image.altText: Becky Lucas, a woman in her 30s, stands smiling on stage, holding a microphone in her hand, and wearing a floral blouse.

props.synopsis: Becky Lucas, Luke McGregor and Jen Carnovale are comedians returning with their first shows since becoming parents. How has parenthood shaped them and their jokes?

title.children: The comedians bringing their babies on tour — and talking parenthood on stage
